name: Bough Keeper: Dainsleif
desc: Katheryne of the Mondstadt Adventurers' Guild seems to have something to tell you.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffff>Unlock Requirements</color>
Archon Quest Chapter I: Act III "A New Star Approaches"
<color=#ffffff>Quest Chain</color>
Archon Quest Chapter I: Act IV - Prelude

customize.name: Dainsleif
customize.desc: A World Quest Series following Dainsleif, a peculiar stranger who is tracking down the Abyss Order.

customize.name: Bough Keeper: Dainsleif
customize.desc: Katheryne of the Mondstadt Adventurers' Guild seems to have something to tell you.

customize.name: Adventure EXP
customize.desc: Adventure EXP. Used to improve Adventure Rank.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Guide to Freedom
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom of travel is one of such. It is the freedom to traverse the land freely without being obstructed.

customize.name: Guide to Resistance
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Resistance is the backbone of the city of Wind.
The history of Mondstadt is one of resistances. People rose up to grant the citizens of Mondstadt the freedom they now enjoy, like the Anemo Archon blowing away the snow, or like Vennessa rising up to fight.

customize.name: Guide to Ballad
customize.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Poetry is the soul of the land of the wind.
Poetry is the manifestations of the will to encourage. In the dark days, the gales in the streets and alleyways whisper words of fury, like the battle drums, like the low rumbling before the storm.

customize.name: Hero's Wit
customize.desc:
Character EXP material. Gives 20000 EXP.
These experiences are extremely precious for a pilgrim traveling through Teyvat in order to be closer to Celestia.

customize.name: Mystic Enhancement Ore
customize.desc:
Weapon EXP material. Gives 10,000 EXP.
Legend has it that this refined ingot contains the memories of battles that had taken place in the land. The weapons that benefit from these memories naturally become sentient.

customize.name: Wagner
customize.desc: Mondstadt's blacksmith who despises small talks and prefers being left to his work.

customize.name: Charles
customize.desc: The bartender at Angel's Share. He will sell various drink-based food items.

customize.name: Dainsleif
customize.desc: A former captain of the Khaenri'ahn Royal Guard, who was cursed by Celestia with immortality.

customize.text:
<color=#ece5d8>Mondstadt, Mondstadt</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne of the Mondstadt Adventurers' Guild seems to have something to tell you.</color>
Quest Objective: Talk to Katheryne in Mondstadt
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Traveler, please, over here.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> It has been a while since you joined the Adventurers' Guild. Are your adventures going smoothly?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I'm recruiting new allies...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: More companions would be nice...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Hmm... is that so? Apart from your own skills, reliable teammates are also indispensable when adventuring.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Another person to count on is always good, after all. But recruiting such dependable companions is no easy matter, is it?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Yup, and it's even harder to get a guide as good as Paimon.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Ah, yes, I do have some information that may be of help to you...
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Let me consult our records... Ah, there it is. There's been a certain blond stranger who arrived in Mondstadt lately, dressed in most unusual clothes.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Blond... dresses all funny... It feels like Paimon's heard this one before...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> W—Wait — do you mean...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Could it be...?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Does that stranger's face look... anything like his/hers!?
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Hmm? Like the Honorary Knight's? No, they couldn't look more different. This stranger is a very tall man, and even has an eyepatch...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> So, just some distant relative of Kaeya's, then...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Seriously? How does this have anything to do with Kaeya? Eyepatches can't prove that you're related, anyway!
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> That stranger declined the Guild's invitation, so I can't say that I know anything about the relationship between him and Mr. Kaeya.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Nonetheless, you can look for him if you're interested. Perhaps he might accept your commission instead.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> After all, it is not uncommon for some adventurers to not want to be limited by the Guild, but be happy to accept a fellow adventurer's requests.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> And should this stranger be a strong adventurer indeed, he would certainly be a big help on your journey.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: But if he's already rejected the Guild...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Sounds like a tough customer...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Please, don't talk down on yourself like that. You are the Honorary Knight of the Knights of Favonius, after all.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Your deeds are the stuff of song for all the bards in the city even now.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Well, alright then. About that stranger...
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> Well, as to further news about him... You may want to ask Mr. Lawrence.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> He stands guard at the city gate, so he may know something about that stranger.
<color=#ffffff>Katheryne:</color> I wish you every success, adventurer.
Quest Objective: Ask Lawrence about the stranger
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> Ah, Honorary Knight. Is something the matter?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> So, I'm looking for a stranger with an eyepatch...
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> A stranger with an eyepatch? Hmm... let me think. Oh yeah. I remember seeing someone like that. A blond stranger dressed in unusual garb.
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> He was wandering all over Mondstadt at first, which I found rather suspicious, so I decided to keep an eye on him for a while.
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> I lost him pretty quickly... Still, I didn't think that this was such a huge matter that we needed our Outrider to pursue him by air.
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> As long as Master Jean is here, there's nothing to fear from some suspicious, unusual-looking person.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That might be true, but if it were up to Jean, she'd take this way more seriously.
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> Haha, that is true. But on the other hand, knowing that Master Jean may overreact to the situation is all the more reason to not tell her, no?
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> Anyways... Oh, yeah! He was at Wagner's smithy for a while before I tried tailin' him. He might have said something to Wagner.
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> You should go ask him. Maybe he has more news about our stranger.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Lawrence
<color=#ffffff>Lawrence:</color> Huh... I wonder what trouble this stranger brings with him...
Quest Objective: Ask Wagner about the stranger
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> What? You need something?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> So, I'm looking for a stranger with an eyepatch...
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> I remember him. He showed up a few days ago, asking to buy a bunch of forging materials.
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> Can't say I've heard of any of the materials he mentioned, though.
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> He then had a look at the weapons in my shop before leaving. I've heard that he can be found drinking at the Angel's Share.
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> If the Knights or the Guild want to get a hold of him, that's the only place to be, haha.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> The Angel's Share? Well, Master Diluc probably has his eye on that stranger too, then.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Anyway, let's go to the Angel's Share and have a look.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Wagner
<color=#ffffff>Wagner:</color> Do those forging materials even exist...
Quest Objective: Ask Charles about the stranger
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> What will it be, grape juice or apple cider?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Another day, another lack of alcoholic options...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hey Charles, have you seen a blond stranger who wears an eyepatch around here by any chance?
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> That I have. He comes here every night — just to drink, though. Doesn't order anything else.
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> He even sometimes mixes his own drinks after he orders them.
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> I don't know anything else about him, but from his selections and mixes, I'd say that he's quite the connoisseur.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> And what's Master Diluc's opinion?
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> Why, I just gave it to you — "quite the connoisseur."
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Investigating everything as always — guess that's Diluc for you...
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> If you're looking for that gentleman, he ordered some new bottle of wine in advance yesterday, so he should be here today, too.
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> There's too many raucous patrons on the first floor, so if you want to wait, best to go to the second.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Charles
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> That customer will most likely be here tonight. You can wait on the second floor until he arrives.
<color=#ece5d8>Angel's Share, Mondstadt</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne from the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt informs you that a very peculiar stranger has come to the city. Following Katheryne's suggestion, you decide to contact that person and see if they accept your request...</color>
Quest Objective: Go to the second floor of the tavern and wait on the seat by the railing
<color=#ffffff>You and Paimon start waiting on the second floor...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Charles:</color> Ah, welcome, sir. The wine that you previously ordered is here.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> He's really here!? Let's go downstairs and have a look.
Quest Objective: Go to the first floor of the tavern and find the stranger
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Hi, I'm an adventurer with the Adventurers' Guild.
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> How do you do? I'm an Honorary Knight of Favonius...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Wow, he's got no intention of paying us any mind, huh...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> So, uh, I'm a traveler...
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> A traveler... you say? Hmph. Why are you traveling?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> I'm looking for my lost relative.
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> Well, that's as good a reason as any... Sit down over there, then.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> So... guess we've broken the ice... What a weird guy.
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> Hmm. That little one beside you...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Emergency food.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That's not true, and you know it!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: My best chum.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh-huh, we're the best of friends!
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> It's indeed a good thing to have someone accompany you on your travels.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> My name's Dainsleif. I suppose you have some business with me?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Well, I was hoping to invite you to adventure with us...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Sure.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...Huh?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> (And he was so cold just a moment before... Paimon's got a baaaad feeling about this!)
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> But I will require advance payment.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: P—payment, you say...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: H—How much?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> 500 Mora, and three answered questions.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The 500 is a one-time fee, and we'll settle the questions in a moment.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> That's... it?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> That's it.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Well, now Paimon's got a really bad feeling. That kind of compensation can't be right...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Well, here's the 500 Mora...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Ah, thank you. Now, as for my questions, I'd like you to answer them here and now...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: And if I answer wrongly?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Do I need to answer them all correctly?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The answer to a question says nothing about right and wrong. Only about differences in attitude.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I only wish to know what your choices are. You need only answer.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Well, alright then.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Question one.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The crisis Mondstadt faced was resolved by an alliance between yourself and that... Anemo Archon who calls himself Venti. Who, in your view, was the key to ending that crisis?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> How did you know that Venti is...!?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I know everything that I should.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Haha... Well...? Answer the question.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: It was Venti.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: It was me.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: The unity of Mondstadt's people gave us the victory.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Is that your answer? Hm... I see.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Question number two.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Rex Lapis, who has defended Liyue Harbor for millennia on end, used his Gnosis to lay down a Contract to End All Contracts, of which the stipulations are still unknown.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Who do you think will defend Liyue Harbor in the future, now that they've lost their deity?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: The adepti.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: The Liyue Qixing.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Everyone in Liyue Harbor.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> So that's your answer... I see.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Now for my final question.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> This world has people who gained Visions, and those who did not.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Which of the two do you think hold more importance in the eyes of the gods?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Those with Visions.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Those without Visions.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Perhaps... none of them do.</color>
Alternative Dialogue: The player chooses the third option at least twice
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> So... this is your answer, then... I understand.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> As I thought... you really are similar to her/him.
Alternative Dialogue: The player doesn't choose the third option mora than once
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> So... this is your answer, then... I understand.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> It seems that you're different from her/him...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> What do you mean, "her/him"?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I'll take that 500 Mora... and now I also understand your views on this world. As we agreed, you may now commission me.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> That said, I only take commissions related to the Abyss Order.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Like you, I am currently on a journey. You intend to find your sibling, while I wish to oppose the Abyss.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Well, I have met some Abyss Mages in the past...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Ugh... Those creatures that serve the Abyss are the fangs and claws by which the Order spreads chaos in this world.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I have come to Mondstadt this time while on the trail of an Abyss Herald...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> An Abyss Herald?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> An even more twisted Abyssal being, one that commands the Abyss Mages.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Come to think of it, since the Stormterror incident ended, we haven't...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Ooh, that's right! We've just been fighting against the Fatui in Liyue, who are human too...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> We haven't encountered the non-human Abyss Order at all.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> There's some reason behind that, I'm afraid.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> It's possible that they may have been under orders to avoid your path.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That does sound pretty dangerous... Maybe they're looking for a better time to ambush us or something...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: They won't defeat me.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I'll defeat them.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh-huh! We're super-duper strong!
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> (That manner... it's just like hers/his.)
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Well then, let's go see for ourselves, shall we? According to the leads I have on hand, the Abyss Order has re-infiltrated the Temple of the Falcon.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Let's meet up at the temple. Perhaps your questions about the Abyss will be answered there.
<color=#ece5d8>Starfell Valley, Mondstadt</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne from the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt informs you that a very peculiar stranger has come to the city. To ask for his help, you meet the him at the Angel's Share tavern. The man, who introduced himself as Dainsleif, accepts your request right away, asking only for 500 Mora and three questions in return. Per his advice, you head to the Temple of the Falcon to track down the Abyss Order...</color>
Quest Objective: Go to the Temple of the Falcon
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> This abandoned temple does bear some marks of the Abyss.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The Falcon of the West... though it can soar in the wind, it ultimately does naught but hover under the light of the gods...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> What are you talking about?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Mm? Oh, it's nothing. Let's head inside.
Quest Objective: Enter the Temple of the Falcon
Quest Objective: Continue exploring
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The scent of the Abyss is getting stronger. It's not far now.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Paimon wonders what the Abyss Heralds look like. Do they look something like the Abyss Mages?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Let's head further in first. If we do see that creature, that'll spare me the explanation either way.
Quest Objective: Talk to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Just a few Abyss Mages? Seems like that Herald might have already left.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Could you tell me more about the Abyss Order?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The Abyss...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> It is chaos, and it is also destruction. It is a morass of inconceivable madness that encroaches upon this world's very foundations.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> That... is why even the Dragon of the East, a servant of a deity, was unable to resist its corrosive powers.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> And the creatures of the Abyss desire nothing less than the overthrow of a world ruled by the archons.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> You seem to know a lot about the Abyss, Dain.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Haha, well, we do have... some history.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I suppose that's as far as chit-chat goes. We should head to Wolvendom.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Judging by the traces I'm following, their next appearance may be within the territory of that old wolf.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Perhaps we may find our Abyss Herald there.
Quest Objective: Leave the Temple of the Falcon
Quest Objective: Go to Wolvendom
<color=#ece5d8>Wolvendom, Mondstadt</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne from the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt informs you that a very peculiar stranger has come to the city. To ask for his help, you meet him at the Angel's Share tavern. The man, who introduced himself as Dainsleif, accepts your request right away, asking only for 500 Mora and three questions in return. Per his advice, you head to the Temple of the Falcon to track down the Abyss Herald. Once the monsters inside the temple are defeated, you decide to look for more traces of the Abyss Herald in Wolvendom.</color>
Quest Objective: Talk to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Well, we're in Wolvendom now. Think Dain's waiting for us up ahead?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> We should meet up with him quick, in case the wolves decide they don't like him.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Lord of Wolvendom, Great Wolf King of the North...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Sharp of fang and keen of claw, and yet dwelling here only...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You know that wolf?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You familiar with that wolf?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> No, nor does it know me.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I only know these things because a previous traveling companion of mine once wanted to hear its story.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Alright, let's go see if that Abyss Herald has stopped by here.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But where do we begin? ...Hmm, are you standing here because of these strange bonfires, Dain?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Indeed. See that, floating above the flames? It's an Abyssal spell.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Knowing what I do of the Order's habits, they've probably left similar marks behind elsewhere. Let's have a look nearby.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> So, their reach extends here, too... Let's have a closer look.
Quest Objective: Look for clues related to the Abyss Order in Wolvendom
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Do you think that those monsters by the bonfire are under the Abyss Order's control? Looks kinda scary... Let's beat 'em up first.
Defeat the enemies
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Phew! That's that. Let's go check out that bonfire.
Investigate the bonfire
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Looks like this bonfire's also got something to do with the Abyss...
Look for the next clue
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> And there's another one of those bonfire-spells!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Looks like the Abyss really has been around here...
Investigate the bonfire
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Yikes! Where did these monsters pop out from? Let's clear them out, and quick!
Quest Objective: Talk to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Have you finished searching?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> We found lots of signs of the Abyss Order...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I searched around these parts and found some signs myself.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> But they were left behind by Abyss Mages, and there was no deeper Abyssal power to them.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> It seems that even an Abyss Herald would not wish to make trouble with the Wolf King of the North.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> We should leave as well. If there's anything praiseworthy about that old wolf, it's his territorial nature.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But now we're out of leads. Are we going to have to give up?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> No, there is one more place we can go.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Let's get a move on, then. I'll wait for you at Stormterror's Lair.
<color=#ece5d8>Stormterror's Lair, Mondstadt</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne from the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt informs you that a very peculiar stranger has come to the city. To ask for his help, you meet him at the Angel's Share tavern. The man, who introduced himself as Dainsleif, accepts your request right away, asking only for 500 Mora and three questions in return. In pursuit of the Abyss Herald, you head to the Temple of the Falcon and Wolvendom. Dainsleif suspects that the enemy might be hiding in Stormterror's Lair.</color>
Quest Objective: Go to Stormterror's Lair
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I've heard about what happened to you during Mondstadt's crisis. When you came, this place was known as Stormterror's Lair.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> But I suppose that this place is more "lair" than "Stormterror" at this point.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> In fact, if my memory serves, this ruin has had largely nothing to do with that dragon for a long time.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> The first time I laid eyes upon the ruins of Old Mondstadt, the Dragon of the East had yet to fall, much less come to nest in this place.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Huh? But Paimon remembers that Dvalin first got in trouble hundreds of years ago...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Don't think too much about it.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Do you remember the Light Actuators that once sealed this ruin?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> If the Abyss Order is interested in this location, then they will not neglect those mechanisms.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Let's go see what the situation is at those Light Actuators.
Quest Objective: Go deeper into Stormterror's Lair
Quest Objective: Defeat all opponents
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Look, there are lots of monsters gathered over there!
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Katheryne from the Adventurers' Guild in Mondstadt informs you that a very peculiar stranger has come to the city. To ask for his help, you meet him at the Angel's Share tavern. The man, who introduced himself as Dainsleif, accepts your request right away, asking only for 500 Mora and three questions in return. In pursuit of the Abyss Herald, you head to the Temple of the Falcon, Wolvendom, and Stormterror's Lair, but to no avail. Finally, you decide to go to the viewpoint overlooking Stormterror's Lair and bring the trip to an end...</color>
Quest Objective: Talk to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> So in the end, we still couldn't find that Abyss Herald. Bummer.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> It is quite a shame.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I wouldn't call not having to gaze upon such a creature a "shame," exactly. Still, I do believe that you will come across one eventually.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> N—No... You're right. If it's a really powerful monster, it would be best to go around it...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> *sigh* How good it would be if all perils one encounters in their journeys could simply be solved by going around them.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You seem to be familiar with journeys.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Speaking from experience, are we?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Once upon a time, yes... I simply have experience from adventuring together with that traveling companion.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh, you know, Dain, you keep talking about that person this, and that person that...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Where are they now, anyway?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> She/He... *sigh*
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> No longer travels.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I'm afraid that traveling can be... too exhausting at times.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Oh, is that how it is... Well, why are you traveling alone, then?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I... still have some things left unfinished. Once they are done, I too will return home to rest.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Yup, and it's good to have a home to come back to, isn't it? We camp out a lot when we travel.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hey Traveler, once you find your sibling, we should find a place to stay too, shouldn't we?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hmm... Mondstadt's Fisherman's Toast is pretty tasty, but Liyue's Wanmin Restaurant is great too...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh, either way, we should settle down in a place where there's good food!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Getting a bit ahead of ourselves, I think...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Home...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Well, it won't be too late to think about where you stay once your journey reaches its end.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> While you're still traveling, you should...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...I sense something familiar. On that cliff.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh? What's familiar?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> I felt it for a moment the previous time we came here, too...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> A familiar feeling, you say? It could be someone you know well, or perhaps a monster.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Could it be... the Abyss?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Whichever it is, we should see it for ourselves, and thus see clearly.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> We can reach the top of that cliff from over there. Let's go.
Quest Objective: Catch up to Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Dain moves really fast, doesn't he...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Let's use that wind current nearby to catch up.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Can you still sense that familiar feeling that you spoke of earlier?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> It's nearby.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But... it doesn't feel like there's anything around here. No monsters, no people, nothing.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Indeed, there doesn't seem to be anything strange about this place. It doesn't look any different from the last time I was here...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: "Last time," you say?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You've been here before?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> My traveling companion brought me here on our previous journey.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> So, Dain, what about you? What's your favorite place?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Me? I... no longer remember.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> I merely followed my traveling companion around on that journey. That's all there was to it.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> ...Hmm?
Quest Objective: Follow Dainsleif
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> A Ruin Guard's footprint... A Ruin Guard was wandering around here?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> No peace to be found, even for a single dandelion...
Quest Objective: Go and examine the dandelion
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> What's gotten into you? You were just spacing out!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: This dandelion... reminds me of...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I... could feel her/him.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh? You mean your sister/brother?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But, how could that be... You only touched that dandelion for a second!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Yes, the moment I touched it...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Perhaps that dandelion bears some sort of "scent" that only you recognize.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> As for why... has it perhaps experienced something related to you?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh, you're saying some real confusing stuff. Paimon doesn't get it at all...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Regardless, I have to get to the bottom of th—!
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Do not rush.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Vexation and anxiety are the enemy of rational thought. Your journey has only just begun, has it not?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> At least you now know that she/he is still on this world.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> At this time, the most important thing is the journey to find her/him itself.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> And I will find her/him.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Yes, and this is something you must keep in mind as the meaning behind your journey.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> May you find your kin at the end of that journey. Well then, let us part ways here for now.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Eh? You're leaving? Already?
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> Only for now. Don't worry, we will meet again.
<color=#ffffff>Dainsleif:</color> After all... I did take 500 Mora... and those three answers you gave me.
